meanings.definition: All parts or areas of something
meanings.sent1: She searched through the allovers of the house to find her missing keys.
meanings.sent2: The treasure map led them to explore the allovers of the island.
meanings.sent3: The kids played hide-and-seek, hiding in the allovers of the playground.
meanings.sent4: His love for her spread to the allovers of his heart, encompassing every corner.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes covered the canvas, reaching the allovers with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: A type of fabric with a pattern covering the entire surface
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful dress made of allovers for the special occasion.
meanings.sent2: The designer showcased a new collection featuring intricate allovers.
meanings.sent3: The costume for the play had bright allovers that caught the audience's attention.
meanings.sent4: The quilt was made with delicate allovers that created a stunning visual effect.
meanings.sent5: The curtains in the room had elegant allovers that added a touch of sophistication.
